text: Faith Lawson MBE (9 February 1922 – 16 October 1998) was a British housing officer and campaigner, chairman of the Pedestrians Association from 1991 to 1997. She was born in West Bridgford, Nottingham, the daughter of John Lawson, a pharmaceutical chemist who worked for and knew Jesse Boot, and a Methodist circuit steward. Her brother was the politician, Hugh Lawson. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:1998 deaths Category:20th-century English politicians Category:People from West Bridgford Category:Walking in the United Kingdom
title: Faith Lawson
